title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Cavaliers Rout Nuggets as Rider Erupts for Historic 40-Point Night**

CLEVELAND (AP) — On a night where offense was a premium for most, one man operated on a different plane entirely. Isaiah Rider didn’t just score; he authored a masterpiece, pouring in a breathtaking 40 points to single-handedly power the Cleveland Cavaliers to a decisive 101-86 victory over the Denver Nuggets.

From the opening tip, it was clear Rider was in the midst of something special. While his teammates labored to find a rhythm, the high-flying guard was a whirlwind of efficiency and explosiveness. He sliced through the Denver defense with a ruthless purpose, his 40 points standing as a monumental figure in a game where no other player on either side cracked the 20-point mark.

The Nuggets, led by LaPhonso Ellis’s 15 points and 11 rebounds, simply had no answer. Rider’s onslaught sucked the life out of any potential Denver run, turning a competitive contest into a showcase for one of the league's most potent scorers at his absolute peak.

The rest of the Cavaliers happily filled their roles, with Bobby Phills adding 17 points and Terrell Brandon contributing 14 points and 8 assists, but this night belonged to Rider. His performance was the engine, the catalyst, and the exclamation point all in one.

In the end, the final score was a mere footnote to the main event. The story was Rider’s 40, a scoring barrage so dominant it rendered all other narratives secondary. It was a historic, carry-the-team-on-your-back performance that will be remembered long after the specifics of the 15-point win fade.
